intro: Oxydectes myrsinites, commonly known as the fireweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often reddish in color. Oxydectes myrsinites is known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and its resilience to drought.
